lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* This class receives a ParsedAnswer object and execute commands based on information
BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(filePath, true));
System.out.println("Successfully added todo task to list.");
BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(filePath, true));
BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(filePath, true));
System.out.println("Item not found. Please try again.");
System.out.println("Item not found. Please try again.");
* This class is responsible for parsing user inputs and
* returns a ParsedAnswer object that contains information that has been parsed by this class.
pa.setDesc("Please check that your input format is correct.");
pa.setDesc("Please check that your input format is correct.");
pa.setDesc("Please specify what you're searching for.");
pa.setDesc("Sorry, but I have no idea what you mean.");
* This is a class that is responsible for storing the tasks into Duke.
// parse the content in the file and add tasks into the arraylist.
BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(filePath, true));
BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(filePath, true));
BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(filePath, true));
* This is a parent class that serves as the main template for the various kind of tasks
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* This class contains operations to manipulate the list stored by Duke.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list: " + "\n");
System.out.println("Sorry, we didn't find anything related to your search terms.");
* This class is responsible for displaying the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("\nHow may I help you today?\n");
